column4: ** There seems to be two different URIs for the same author; Ibn al-Kalbi corresponds to the more common shuhra
** Author date of death is wrong
** According to EI3, the nisba "Ishbili" is wrong
** The lexeme which occurs in the title is "kurab" (sg. kurba) and not "kurah"

** After I finished working on this text and creating a “text tagged” issue, I realized that the exact name in the PDF is “تسمية مشايخ” not “تسمية شیوخ”; however I’m not sure this is important or not. This is the link to the PDF: https://ia802709.us.archive.org/32/items/tmnszm/tmnszm.pdf
** The genitive form of "ulū" is "ulī" and not "ulā."

** This text is a compilation of letters, sermons and sayings of Ali, but I believe attributing its authorship as a book to Ali is a bit problematic. I think it is more sensible to attribute it to the compiler Sharif al-Radi (note, not SharifRida as now in OpenITI!): https://iis.ac.uk/fr/taxonomy /term/25586
** Author name transcribed incorrectly in URI

** The name of the book is “التوكل على الله”. It is from a collection entitled “مجموعة رسائل ابن أبي الدنيا” (see the PDF in the link below). So, the title “رسائل فی توکل” is probably not a correct title. The book is just one very short treatise, not a collection of treatises

** The Shia version (unlike the JK and the Shamela versions) is not “علل الترمذي” or “العلل الصغير” as it is written in the METADATA and the title. It is “شفاء العلل في شرح كتاب العلل” as it is written in the first line of the text.
** The Shamela0009170 version (unlike the other versions in “0261AbuHasanCijli.MacrifatThiqat” folder) is not “معرفة الثقات”, but it is “تاريخ الثقات”, another book written by the same author
** Caliya is a defective nominal form and /-i/ is a short vowel
** nisba not correct; typo in title
** Talab should have the same morphological scheme as Halab
** Shuhra is Ibn Habib al-Halabi; wrong lexeme ("muntaqa") in the title; correct is "muqtafa."
** Al-Tufi seems to be the shuhra
** The  At-Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ at-Tanqīḥ = at-Tawdīḥ sharḥ matn at-tanqīḥ is a commentary of al-Mahbubi of his own work Tanqīḥ al-uṣūl
** Commentary by Taftazani of Mahbubi's Tawḍīḥ fī ḥall ghawāmiḍ at-Tanqīḥ. Title of Taftazani's work: At-Talwīḥ ʿalā t-tawḍīḥ li-matn at-tanqīḥ fī uṣūl al-fiqh
** Wrong vowel in wafayat; no "wa-" in title
** Spelling of Zakariyya'; wrong vowel in maqsad
** Find the PDF here: http://shiabooks.net/library.php?id=10050 and the information of the book here: http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/21660399

** Although the book is a summary (produced by Amili, as written on the cover page), the word “مختصر” does not appear in the title. So, I think it must be deleted. Find the PDF here: http://shiabooks.net/library.php?id=7774 and the information of the book here: http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/31148194 and http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/4770240873
** The "a" after "Arbacun" might be redundant. However, I'm not sure at all
** typo: الإمام الحافظ أبي الحسن محمد بن أسلم الطوسي

** The name of the book is “كتاب الرؤية” not “رؤية الله”. See the PDF here: https://ia800309.us.archive.org/22/items/kawasafi_hotmail_20150516/%D8%B1%D8%A4%D9%8A%D8%A9%20%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%84%D9%87%20%D9%84%D9%84%D8%AF%D8%A7%D8%B1%D9%82%D8%B7%D9%86%D9%8A%20-%20%D8%B1%D9%81%D8%B9%20%D9%83%D8%A7%D9%88%D8%A7%20%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%AF%20%D8%A3%D8%A8%D9%88%20%D8%B9%D8%A8%D8%AF%20%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A8%D8%B1.pdf And the WorldCat link here: http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/31512770

** This text is actually “سر العالمين وكشف ما في الدارين” by Ghazali. The text is accessible on Github via this link: https://github.com/OpenITI/0525AH/blob/master/data/0505Ghazali/0505Ghazali.SirrCalamin/0505Ghazali.SirrCalamin.JK009402-ara1
** typo in the title: Arabic title is أحكام أهل الملل
** Typo in the author's name: Arabic عبد العزيز

** This text is not a book. It is the transcribed version of some audio files interpreting “الموطأ” (by Malik ibn Anas), presented by the commentator, Dr. “عبد الكريم الخضير”, who is still alive (find his website here: https://shkhudheir.com/1586325503 and the original audio files of the text here: https://archive.org/details/Sharh_Al-Muwatta_mp3_pdf). So, the author is not Malik ibn Anas, but it is the commentator (maybe the text should be removed from the corpus, since it is not a book at all. I’m not sure).
** The name is al-Maqqari, not al-Maqarri
** The author normally seems to be referred to as Sahmi
